name: LL-1001 - Pamoja / Jewel "Ooh Baby" b/w "Paradise"
description: CHICAGO, 1975-1980. PAMOJA was the brainchild of Keith Stevens and his former wife. Together they played locally and recorded this one release on Keith’s own label, Keiper records. Over the years this local Chicago release has found its way into the hands of Dj’s and collectors worldwide. The B side of the record, “Ooh Baby”, with it’s superior drum mix & haunting vocal, has over the years been established as a top billing dance jam the world over. JEWEL was established a couple of years after Pamoja folded with Keith’s close friend Oliver Miller. The two assembled a group and recorded “Paradise” in an attempt to capitalize on the new sound of Earth Wind & Fire. The record was released in small quantity on the band’s own label, Jewel Star. After releasing this record local impresario Jim Porter discovered the band and quickly signed them to his own Erect Records (also home of IND, Wrecking Crew, & Alexander O’neal). It was on this label the team released a full LP (Cut ‘n’ Polised) & and 12” disco single for the band’s theme song, “Jewel’s Groove”. Reissued here is “Paradise”, the groups first official release, which has gone on to be a massive collector’s item and huge spin on the global Modern Soul scenes. Pamoja “Ooh Baby” Jewel “Paradise”

name: LL-1002 - Family Of Eve "I Want To Be Loved By You" b/w "Please Be Truthful"
description: PITTSBURGH, 1980: FAMILY OF EVE is a local group living in Steel City. According to Jeree studio owner Don Garvin, FOE was a tremendous local success in the 80’s, in fact the group still performs locally to this day in “the Burg”. When listening to this disc it is hard to imagine this group not having a national hit with either one of these tunes! Pure top shelf disco/R&B here, recorded at the same studio as Wet Cherry of “Play That Funky Music Whiteboy” fame. In fact, Nile Rodgers of Chic called the studio to scout for more local talent being recorded in this studio and Studio/Label owner Garvin forget to mention Family of Eve to him at that time. Who knows? Maybe history would’ve been a little different if this record found it’s way into the hands of N. Rodgers? Please enjoy this quality slab of premium Disco & Soul. “I Want To Be Loved By You” “Please Be Truthful”

name: LL-1003 - Ramsey & Co. "Love Call" b/w "Leg Grease"
description: NEW YORK, 1979 – RAMSEY & CO. was the group Mainor Ramsey had pieced together to play the Catskills supper club circuit. Their only release being the super charged sexy disco hit “Love Call” backed with super blaxploitation fodder “Leg Grease”, release on Mainor’s own label, Ramco. This limited styrene 7” single was sold exclusively at the groups live shows and never saw it’s way into proper distribution. 500 press? Oddly this limited release eventually found it’s way onto the dancefloors of the UK’s northern soul/modern soul scene, and became a super smash ripping up floors whenever played. The sheer quality of this tune mixed with the utter rarity has made this record nearly impossible to find and quite valuable on the collector’s market. We did some serious homework and located Mainor in NYC. We were stunned to learn that despite this tune’s mega reputation (not to mention world famous DJ Harvey re-edit on BBE) that Mainor had no idea about his tune’s “afterlife”. We proudly present to you the very first vinyl release of this deep disco classic. “Love Call” “Leg Grease”

name: LL-1004 - Halo "Let Me Do It" b/w extended disco edit 12" - SOLD OUT
description: PASADENA, CA 1980: What an amazing tune! This was first brought to our attention via top dj’s on the UK’s modern soul scene. Halo is the product of three very talented young lads who met in Pasadena during the late 70’s. Karvin Lee Johnson, James King Jr., & Greg Coleman started the group after realizing they had what it took to make it in the industry at that time. Greg & James had moved out to California from Detroit, following the moves of Berry Gordy and Motown, it was in Pasadena where they pooled together with local talent Karvin L. Johnson. The “Let Me Do It” session was produced by “Welcome Back Cotter” & “Cooley High” actor Laurence Hilton Jacobs at a studio located on the corner of Sunset & Vine. This brilliant session also featured the stalwart session drummer James Gadson (Dyke and the Blazers, Charles Wright) lending the tune its ROCK solid beat. “Let Me Do It” original version

name: LL-1005 - Crystal Band "Music" b/w "Giving My Love Up To You"
description: BATON ROUGE, LA 1979 – Henry Turner’s Crystal material was sitting on the shelf all these years. Rumour/Legend/Myth has it that there was an original pressing of “Music” released. However the unstoppable flip side to this release, “Giving Up My Love To You” hasn’t seen the light of day since it was recorded, some 30 odd years ago. Already the song has been charting on clandestine lists of the more reputable Dj’s in the Northern UK. “Music” is also a total modern soul monster and is currently exploding onto soul & funk scenes worldwide. “Music” “Giving My Love Up To You”
